--- title: solutions keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "This module contains the different function approximators available to solve PDEs." ---

getActivation[source]

getActivation(a)

block[source]

block(i, o, a)

class Solution[source]

Solution(inputs, outputs, layers, neurons, activations) :: Module

Currently, only MLPs are supported as solution approximators wiht same number of neurons and activation function per layer

Example

pde = PDE(inputs=['x', 't'], outputs=['p'])

# add values and bocos

mlp = {'layers': 3, 'neurons': 100, 'activations': 'relu'}
pde.buildSolution(mlp)

pde.solution

Solution(
  (fc_in): Sequential(
    (0): Linear(in_features=2, out_features=100, bias=True)
    (1): ReLU(inplace=True)
  )
  (fc_hidden): ModuleList(
    (0): Sequential(
      (0): Linear(in_features=100, out_features=100, bias=True)
      (1): ReLU(inplace=True)
    )
    (1): Sequential(
      (0): Linear(in_features=100, out_features=100, bias=True)
      (1): ReLU(inplace=True)
    )
    (2): Sequential(
      (0): Linear(in_features=100, out_features=100, bias=True)
      (1): ReLU(inplace=True)
    )
  )
  (fc_out): Linear(in_features=100, out_features=1, bias=True)
)
test_input = torch.tensor([[1, 2], [3, 4]]).float()
test_output = pde.solution(test_input)
test_output

tensor([[0.0453],
        [0.0198]], grad_fn=<AddmmBackward>)
